tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V3.0.0.0 -- build 3 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Sam Evans and Shauna Guinn, and special guest Jo Brand joins the show via video link. Plus, clips from the BBC food archive.(n)

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond focus on Scottish fruit, cooking an apple and bramble crumble with drambuie custard. Joining them are Ross Mitchell and Rosalind Erskine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned in London, Manchester and Ulverston, Cumbria, including a house which is across three floors.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Scotland v England. A full re-run of the Euro 96 Group A encounter at Wembley Stadium. Both sides were looking for a first victory in the competition after drawing their openers against the Netherlands and Switzerland respectively, and it was Paul Gascoigne who stole the headlines with a famous goal.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore sees what people are about to throw away at a Surrey recycling centre, rescuing two car axle stands, a farmhouse table and some rusty old railings for transformation.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The team are in Leamington Spa to help Robert and Gemma and their daughter Darcey, who is afraid of the family's nettle-strewn, overgrown garden.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is on a house-hunting mission with a couple who have £750,000 to break away from their London suburb and find a rural family home in North Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Moana
programme.desc: To save her island home from a terrible curse, a brave Polynesian teenager must set sail and journey into the great blue yonder with the aid of a legendary hero. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a writers special edition of the general knowledge quiz, with the contestants Martina Cole, Mark Billingham, Liz Pichon, Nick Sharratt, Juno Dawson, Nadia Shireen, Adam Kay and Ian McMillan.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Laughs
programme.desc: The comedian looks back at some of the best moments from the Michael McIntyre's Big Show series, revisiting some of the biggest laughs from the past five seasons. Tonight, he looks back on the shocked look on Judge Rinder's face as he is woken from his sleep to play the Midnight Gameshow, and the unforgettable Send to Alls with Holly Willoughby and Jamie Oliver. The host also relives the moment Gary Barlow surprises the audience by singing along to their karaoke versions of some classic Take That songs.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a new variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to discuss the top 10 in Premier League history for a chosen category.(n)

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Two American bomb disposal experts operating in Iraq are assigned a new leader after their previous one dies in action. However, the sergeant's reckless attitude and love of battle consistently puts them at risk. Kathryn Bigelow's Oscar-winning drama, starring Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Guy Pearce and Ralph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Laughs
programme.desc: The comedian looks back at some of the best moments from the Michael McIntyre's Big Show series, revisiting some of the biggest laughs from the past five seasons. Tonight, he looks back on the shocked look on Judge Rinder's face as he is woken from his sleep to play the Midnight Gameshow, and the unforgettable Send to Alls with Holly Willoughby and Jamie Oliver. The host also relives the moment Gary Barlow surprises the audience by singing along to their karaoke versions of some classic Take That songs.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a new variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to discuss the top 10 in Premier League history for a chosen category.(n)

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Two American bomb disposal experts operating in Iraq are assigned a new leader after their previous one dies in action. However, the sergeant's reckless attitude and love of battle consistently puts them at risk. Kathryn Bigelow's Oscar-winning drama, starring Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Guy Pearce and Ralph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and guest presenter Ben Shires help three children to plan a game show-themed wedding, featuring embarrassing questions for their parents.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Naomi Wilkinson plays clips featuring an angry, dinosaur-like creature on the warpath and a lemming terrorising a cat.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: The most unusual places in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Long-running children's magazine programme.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores habitats shared by humans and dangerous creatures, and helps remove a venomous snake from the garden of a family in South America.(n)

programme.title: Forces of Nature with Brian Cox
programme.desc: The physicist goes on a grand tour of the planet to explain how the Earth's beauty is created by just a handful of forces, beginning by examining the diversity of shapes in the natural world. Off the coast of Canada, Brian explains how massive icebergs that surge down from Greenland and into shipping lanes of the Atlantic emerge due to a powerful yet infinitesimal force of nature, while revealing how honeycombs made by bees in Nepal to store their precious honey conceal a mathematical rule.(n)

programme.title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy has a day where everything seems to go wrong, but gets no sympathy from his family. He becomes convinced that bad things only ever happen to him, but then his parents, his brother and his sister all suffer terrible days of their own. Family comedy based on Judith Viorst's series of children's books, starring Ed Oxenbould, Steve Carell and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Time moves on for the volunteers from 1973 to 1976, when disco was dominating the dance floors and maxi dresses were in vogue. It was also a time of great hope for women, with the Sex Discrimination Act having just been passed and the Equal Pay Act now in force. But will the changes in the law lead to equality on the factory floor or will the workers' hopes be dashed once again?(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain explores the culinary traditions of the Peak District and surrounding areas, beginning by putting her own twist on the classic Bakewell tart. She then joins Ian Barrett to learn how to make Derbyshire oatcakes, before using them as a casing for her potato and dill samosas.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewer competition hosted by Joe Lycett continues. This time, the six remaining contestants take part in a series of challenges as they return to the sewing room to revive the glamorous, and sometimes ridiculous style, of the 1980s. Patrick Grant and Esme Young challenge the sewers to get down to business with the trickiest pattern so far, a woman's power jacket, before they are tasked with turning high-vis workman clothes into a party outfit in the Transformation Challenge. Finally in the Made to Measure Challenge, the contestants create their own versions of a cocktail dress.(n)

programme.title: The £100K House: The Final Fix
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor revisits people he and Kieran Long followed as they built their homes from scratch for less than £100,000, and helps them complete their projects. Sue and Tim still need an entrance hall staircase as a centrepiece to transform their home, but they require a series of low-cost lessons to have a chance of achieving high-end results. In north-east Scotland, Marcus and Sholto want to create outbuildings to stand alongside their rural home, and Piers presents them with a design that takes inspiration from a building on the banks of Loch Doine.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A selection of film and television appearances made by actor and dancer Gene Kelly over the years. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Carousel
programme.desc: A criminal struggling to support his pregnant wife dies during a botched armed robbery, but is given the chance to return to life 15 years later to help his family and teach his daughter a valuable lesson. Adaptation of Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical, starring Gordon MacRae, Shirley Jones, Cameron Mitchell, Barbara Ruick and Gene Lockhart.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: To get some tips for completing a complex fisherman's jumper, Ruth Goodman heads to pretty Polperro, and Tessa Dunlop takes the plunge into the glamorous history of British lidos.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall discovers how the people and animals of Dartmoor live alongside each other, visiting an ancient hill farm housing dozens of house martins and swallows.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: England v West Indies Greatest Matches
programme.desc: A look back at the memorable 1984 Test from Lord's. An England side containing the likes of Ian Botham and Bob Willis took on a Windies team that cemented their reputation during the series as one of the greatest of all time.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Private Pike receives his call-up papers and unexpectedly passes his medical with flying colours, much to the horror of his mollycoddling mother. Classic comedy first aired in 1975, starring Ian Lavender, Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore Sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown.(n)

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the blues guitarist, narrated by the man himself, as he charts his six decades in the music business, and why his insatiable desire to grow his artistic voice led him to quit a stream of successful bands, from the Yardbirds and John Mayall and the Bluesbreakers to short-lived supergroups Cream and Blind Faith. Clapton also talks about his battles with drugs and alcohol, his love for George Harrison's wife Pattie Boyd and the tragic loss of his son in an accident. Including archive interviews with BB King, George Harrison and Jimi Hendrix.(n)

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.(n)

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: In Argyll, George and Sybil set off to gather in their sheep from over six square miles of rugged mountainside before taking some of them to market, while soon-to-be-wed couple Martin and Mel introduce their newly purchased rams to their flock of ewes. In the far north beyond Inverness, John heads to market to teach his 13-year-old son James how to buy a good flock of ewes, and Sandy sets off on a 1,600-mile journey from his home on Lewis to sell his specialist Hebridean mutton and beef around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates unusual natural events, with the help of eyewitness accounts, scientists and footage of the occurrences.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: The first of three programmes in which cameras explore some of the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everest's notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of America's few surviving condor chicks.(n)

programme.title: Billy Elliot
programme.desc: A northern youngster is pushed into taking boxing lessons by his macho dad - but secretly enrols in a ballet class instead, where it soon becomes clear he has a real talent for fancy footwork. However, he faces a tough time convincing his father that dance is a worthwhile pursuit. Comedy drama, starring Jamie Bell, Julie Walters and Gary Lewis.(n)

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Denardo explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: Your Stories
programme.desc: Philippa Thomas hears from people around the world about their extraordinary experiences during the pandemic and how Covid-19 has changed their lives.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Dateline London
programme.desc: Foreign correspondents currently posted to London look at events in the UK through outsiders' eyes, and at how the issues of the week are being tackled around the world.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: A guide to the latest gadgets, websites, games and computer industry news.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: What Next
programme.desc: With coronavirus outbreaks at different stages around the world we explore what might happen as restrictions change and people adjust to a new reality.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: London in the Shadow of a Virus
programme.desc: This is the story of one hospital and one community in the time of COVID 19. As the UK's death toll creeps closer to 40,000, BBC News has been given unprecedented access to doctors and nurses serving in one of the most densely populated parts of London.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: In this edition of Talking Movies the programme reviews some of the top documentaries of 2020 featuring interviews with leading filmmakers and their contributors. (12+).(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Sport: Your Questions Answered
programme.desc: BBC Sports Editor Dan Roan, and reporters Laura Scott and Simon Stone answer your questions about how Sport has been affected by the Coronavirus pandemic, how it will return, and what the cost will be to the various sporting bodies.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Three Years in Wuhan
programme.desc: Robotics company CEO Xu Jishui and software entrepreneur Huang Tiesen fight to establish their start-ups in Wuhan's fast-growing new technology sector. (12+).(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: London in the Shadow of a Virus
programme.desc: This is the story of one hospital and one community in the time of COVID 19. As the UK's death toll creeps closer to 40,000, BBC News has been given unprecedented access to doctors and nurses serving in one of the most densely populated parts of London.(n)

programme.title: The Film Review
programme.desc: Mark Kermode gives his unique take on the best and worst of the week's film and DVD releases.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Laura Bicker tells the inside story of South Korea's virus hunters. How did they manage to keep the death toll so low, and what can the rest of the world learn from South Korea? (12+).(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: The Papers
programme.desc: An early look at the next edition of the newspapers, featuring informed and engaging conversation with guest contributors.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: The Papers
programme.desc: An early look at the next edition of the newspapers, featuring informed and engaging conversation with guest contributors.(n)

programme.title: The Film Review
programme.desc: Mark Kermode gives his unique take on the best and worst of the week's film and DVD releases.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends go on a treasure hunt, and Mr Tumble's cake goes on an adventure!(n)

programme.title: Baby Jake
programme.desc: Nibbles the rabbit and Baby Jake go on a countryside adventure.(n)

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubby Car takes the Teletubbies to the Hidey Hup where they discover the Tubby Slidey. Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po have great fun sliding down again and again.(n)

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: The cub organises a series of games for Topsy's party, but not everybody is good at them.(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat: SDS
programme.desc: It's an extra special delivery for Pat and Jess when they have to deliver a giant inflatable shark in time for Sealife Awareness Day at the school.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula paint a giant mural at Amma's nursery, but Bing's rainbow colours spoil Sula's tree design and she is upset that her hard work has been ruined.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The bunny gets stuck in Padget's shop while playing a game of hide-and-seek with Flop.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Energetic animation for children aged two to five, following Duggee the dog and his Squirrel Club.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Energetic animation for children aged two to five, following Duggee the dog and his Squirrel Club.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: It's a dark night and Glitch is flying his Grim HQ over the sea around the Isles of Scilly.(n)

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter and his friends try to find the perfect place to eat the radishes they took from Mr McGregor's garden, but fail to realise a thief is hankering after the vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Tweak tests the Gup-X down in the midnight zone, but a yeti crab damages the ship putting both itself and the octonauts in danger.(n)

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Harriet helps Timmy find a painted egg in a treasure hunt.(n)

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tee trips and hurts his leg. Mo makes it better with a special plaster and some special mum fussing. Tee realises that he quite enjoys the special treatment and begins to milk it, but will Mo cotton on?(n)

programme.title: The Furchester Hotel
programme.desc: The team launches a babysitting service, but trouble arrives in the form of Adrianna, a baby monster who refuses to stay put for nap-time.(n)

programme.title: Biggleton
programme.desc: Frankie the Business Woman is busy looking after her sister's baby but needs some help to get the baby to take a nap.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble goes on a surprise bus journey with his family. Meanwhile, Justin and his friends head on a boat adventure.(n)

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Recycling gives Nick an idea for a Popcast Song about a rusty old robot.(n)

programme.title: The Baby Club at Home
programme.desc: Ideas of things to do with your baby that celebrate family.(n)

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: Robert tries hard to get his latest Climate-mate invention working properly, in order to cool down the temperature in Justin's House!(n)

programme.title: Andy's Prehistoric Adventures
programme.desc: Andy Day travels 49 million years back in time to find out what colour the eggs of a giant prehistoric bird were and must protect a chick against a colony of supersized ants.(n)

programme.title: Catie's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: CBeebies rally driver Catie Running shows off three amazing machines that all have sails.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie's teacher comes for a home visit and the Brooklyn-Bells want Waffle to be on his best behaviour, but Waffle cannot stop chewing everything.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: While Zoe helps Doug with his homework project, about Alaska, Simon and Jess take Waffle and Evie to the shops to buy new school shoes. However, Waffle causes chaos.(n)

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: Topsy and Tim make Mummy a 'welcome home' surprise for the front of the house with Dad.(n)

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Children from all over the world demonstrate their favourite recipes, and find out where the ingredients they have used come from.(n)

programme.title: Apple Tree House
programme.desc: When Sam, David and Kobi find a lost piano, they aim to reunite it with the owner.(n)

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: Tig is scared of fireworks, but Woolly tells her there is nothing wrong with not liking something.(n)

programme.title: Melody
programme.desc: Mum sets up a treasure hunt in the park for Melody, before they listen to The Thieving Magpie by Rossini, and the little girl imagines a story about the clever birds.(n)

programme.title: Down on the Farm
programme.desc: Storm Huntley helps plant some lavender, while JB Gill finds out about a spring vegetable and meets some children who are making fresh food on a farm. Plus, a visit a bakery to see how to make pizza.(n)

programme.title: Where in the World
programme.desc: In Ghana, Tyra is scrubbed from head to toe by her mum and gets dressed up for church. In India, six-year-old Anushka, goes shopping for eggs with her grandad, and discovers where eggs really come from. And in Italy, seven-year-old Mario is put through a gruelling work-out at his weekly kick-boxing class by his teacher Vincenzo.(n)

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Twins Daisy and Lily take a trip to the beach with their cousins. Dogs Foxy and Saffy join in too, and love chasing after balls on the sand. After all the seaside fun, the whole family heads to the beach cafe to enjoy an ice-cream. Back at home, the sisters take care of a special visitor - Grandma Owl the school cuddly toy. Together they embark on an adventure around the house and take lots of photos.(n)

programme.title: What's the Big Idea
programme.desc: Hugo and his friends encourage young viewers to question the world around them.(n)

programme.title: Get Well Soon
programme.desc: Dr Ranj tells Deep that jelly and ice-cream can help with a cold sore.(n)

programme.title: Footy Pups
programme.desc: Rachel Yankey and her team learn the importance of playing fairly, while the Footy Pups find themselves in a sticky situation.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble would like to hear a bedtime story, but not before he gets ready for bed. Meanwhile, Justin experiences a magical bedtime adventure with his friends.(n)

programme.title: Ferne and Rory's Vet Tales
programme.desc: Ferne Corrigan meets up with Jayden and Skyla at a city fame in London, where a vet is visiting to check the goats. Meanwhile, Rory Crawford observes an elephant receiving veterinary attention at a safari park.(n)

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know
programme.desc: Maddie finds out how an electric car works and how wind is made..(n)

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bitz and Bob's junk stall sells out of everything, including Bob's robo-helmet! Bob is horrified.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The team dives into action as Glitch's treasure hunt endangers Australia's Great Barrier Reef.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle tries to impress on his first day as a listening dog at school.(n)

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: Andy Day travels back in time to the era of the ammonites, which inhabited Earth 149 million years ago. They were a type of mollusc that lived in shoals in the sea. Andy is challenged to find a shell to replace the one he broke at the museum, and along the way he comes face to face with the eustreptospondylus - a swimming dinosaur.(n)

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Ashley Kendall, Aimee Campbell-Nottage, Donna Mullings and Simon Herdman present a poetry programme using a mix of sign language, the spoken word, music and animation to bring poems to life and capture the imaginations of both deaf and hearing children.(n)

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Barry refuses to admit he has been playing with Kari's building blocks, but as he tells more and more lies, he realises bending the truth can result in people getting hurt.(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.desc: Animation explaining why puff adders shed their skin.(n)

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: The presenter goes back in time to search for a dung beetle for the museum, but is distracted by a baby diplodocus taking its first steps.(n)

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Mack tries to help Daisy by bringing Twinkle the pony to the vet's surgery. Twinkle escapes and ends up in the Big Hub - which doesn't please Moira at all.(n)

programme.title: Katie Morag
programme.desc: The school's teacher is retiring, which worries Katie, on top of news that her mum and dad are having another baby.(n)

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The girl, her pet and Flamingo arrange a nautical surprise for John's birthday.(n)

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: Charlie is embarrassed when Lola refuses to take off her alligator costume and insists on wearing it everywhere she goes.(n)

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tee insists on wearing his favourite Action Ape outfit all afternoon, no matter what games he is playing. However, when the outfit gets dirty, Tee is heartbroken.(n)

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Small Clanger is fishing in the music boat and catches a beautiful silver seed. Mother and Tiny help him to plant it and it grows into a very shy little plant.(n)

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy decides to kiss everything in the garden, but the Ninky Nonk feels left out. Narrated by Derek Jacobi.(n)
